Hi Jackson -

I tried reproducing in 1.8.0 with a usual scope/processors setup against 
the given URI, and could not: the page is extracted without error and 
crawling continues to deeper pages.

Further, looking at the 1.8 source code for UURIFactory.java, there is 
no call to String.substring() on (or even near) line 459, as indicated 
in your exception stack.

Are you sure you're using a relatively-stock Heritrix 1.8?

- Gordon @ IA

jacksonpope wrote:
> Hiya all,
> 
> When trying to crawl http://ibeatrice.blogspot.com, Heritrix 1.8 
> (under WCT) only collects the front page and prints the following 
> stack track to runtime-errors.log:
> 
> 2007-09-19T11:31:19.010Z    -5     156090 
> http://ibeatrice.blogspot.com/ - - text/html #002 
> 20070919103117804+1143 M76J6W7JATL7CIVXELKU2PECCRO3FUUA - 
> err=java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException,3t
>  java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of 
> range: 128
> 	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1935)
> 	at org.archive.net.UURIFactory.fixup(UURIFactory.java:459)
> 	at org.archive.net.UURIFactory.create(UURIFactory.java:336)
> 	at org.archive.net.UURIFactory.getInstance
> (UURIFactory.java:285)
> 	at 
> org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlURI.createAndAddLinkRelativeToBase
> (CrawlURI.java:1174)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorJS.considerStrings
> (ExtractorJS.java:155)
> 	at 
> org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.processScriptCode
> (ExtractorHTML.java:380)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.processScript
> (ExtractorHTML.java:612)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.extract
> (ExtractorHTML.java:550)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.extract
> (ExtractorHTML.java:483)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.extractor.Extractor.innerProcess
> (Extractor.java:67)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process
> (Processor.java:103)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri
> (ToeThread.java:306)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run
> (ToeThread.java:153)
> 
> I've turned off all the Extractors but the HTML one, and its still 
> going in to the ExtractorJS code and throwing an exception. Is there 
> any way to stop this happening? Moving to a newer version of 
> Heritrix is planned in the medium term, but because it's built in to 
> WCT it's not a viable short-term workaround.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Jack
